author: Special Correspondent
text:
Nationalist Congress Party leader Chhagan Bhujbal’s nephew, Sameer, was on Monday sent to judicial custody for 14 days.

He was in the custody of the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for five days following his arrest last week.

Mr. Bhujbal was arrested on February 1 in a case of money laundering, siphoning off funds and causing a loss of Rs. 840 crore to the exchequer, of which Rs. 114 crores have been so far recovered.

While submitting its application for judicial custody, the ED’s lawyer, Hiten Venegavkar informed the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court that investigations are underway to locate and attach all the proceeds of crime committed by Mr. Bhujbal under the PMLA Act.
title: Sameer Bhujbal sent to 14-day judicial custody
